cello.alt.servlet.script
Class ScriptLoader

java.lang.Object
  cello.alt.servlet.script.ScriptLoader
Direct Known Subclasses:
ContextScriptLoader, DirectoryScriptLoader, JarScriptLoader, MultiScriptLoader
public abstract class ScriptLoader
extends java.lang.Object

Default interface for a ScriptLoader loader. ScriptLoader is intended to mimic Java's ClassLoader.

Author:
Marcello

Returns:

findLoadedScript

protected JavaScript findLoadedScript(java.lang.String name)
Returns a previously (cached) loaded script. If the script cannot be found, null is returned.

Parameters:
name - the name of the script
Returns:
the cached script or null

Returns:
the script
Throws:
ScriptNotFoundException - if the script could not be loaded (does not exist)

getResource

public Resource getResource(Resource context,
                            java.lang.String path)
                     throws ResourceException
Gets a resource relative to another resource. This can be a relative path or an absolute path starting with /. This method is similar to Class.getResource(java.lang.String).

Parameters:
context - the resource the resource is relative to
path - the path to this
Returns:
the resource object
Throws:
ResourceException - if the resource could not be loaded

Returns the module provider used by this script loader.

Returns:
the module provider

isValidName

private static boolean isValidName(java.lang.String name)
Returns whether or not a particular module/script name is valid. Valid module/script names are of the following format:
  • abc
  • abc.*
  • abc.xyz
  • abc.xyz123.*

Parameters:
name - the module/script name to check
Returns:
true if the name is valid

getPath

public static java.lang.String getPath(java.lang.String name)
                                throws java.lang.RuntimeException
Converts a module/script name into a file system path. This essentially replaces '.' with '/', and '.*' with '/'. Few examples:
  • abc -> abc
  • abc.* -> abc/
  • abc.xyz -> abc/xyz.js
  • abc.xyz123.* -> abc/xyz123/

Parameters:
name - the module/script name
Returns:
the rewritten path
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the module name was invalid

getParentLoader

public ScriptLoader getParentLoader()
Returns:
Returns the parentLoader.
